text:
Okay, back to the competition
with our Dueling Club round.

We've only got two
more questions to go.

There's only
one Ravenclaw player

who hasn't played
this round yet, Vincent.

And who better to pose
that question than one

of Ravenclaw's most
recognizable house alumni.

Please welcome
the talented actor who

provided comic relief
from beyond the grave as

Ravenclaw's Moaning Myrtle,
Shirley Henderson!
[cheers and applause]

- Hello, Helen,
and hello Ravenclaws.

I'm really rooting for you
to win this tournament

and I am so thrilled
to be a part of it.

- How lovely--lovely
to see you Shirley.

- When you think of Ravenclaws,
you think of wisdom

and a love of learning,
and that intelligence is

going to come in handy
for this question.

Ravenclaws are smart,
and Harry was attracted
to the intelligent Cho Chang.

- Okay, so,
do you have an answer for us?

- One of the flavors associated
with fall is pumpkin

and that's why
when I saw this scene,
I would order the same thing,

so my order would
be pumpkin pasties.
- Let's see if you're right.

- The answer is D,
pumpkin pasties.
Yay, you're right!
- Nice job, dude!

- Well done, Vince,
you've just scored 50 points.

Let's see
how your housemates did.
House also got it right,

so another 50 points
for Ravenclaw.
Well done, Ravenclaw!

All right, Slytherin,
your 50 Point Dueling Club
question goes to Michelle.

He played the slicked
back Slytherin bully
Harry Potter fans love to hate.

Please welcome the fine
actor Tom Felton.
[cheers and applause]

- Hello, Dame Helen,
and hello, Slytherins.

I know you're going
to represent the house
with honor in this tournament,

and you are already
doing fabulous.
- You got this.

- Now Slytherins are
famous for being shrewd

and hopefully that will help
you answer this next question.
- Michelle, what's your answer?

- So this
professor gets mentioned

by the man formerly
known as Tom Riddle,

who asks if it's true
that Professor Merrythought

is retiring so my answer is C,
Professor Galatea Merrythought.
- Let's see if you're accurate.

- The answer is C,
of course, Merrythought.
[cheers and applause]

- Congratulations, you just
added 50 points to your score.
